p: In their review, Awouafack et al. (2015) compiled a total of 52 natural flavonoids (indicated by (*) in Table 3) from five Eriosema species ( E. chinense, E. tuberosum, E. kraussianum, E. glomeratum and E. robustum), including dihydrochalcones ( 1–2), flavonols ( 10–13, 16–20), flavanonols or dihydroflavonols ( 23–33), flavanones ( 34–41), isoflavones ( 43, 47–52, 54, 56–60, 62, 64 –70) and one isoflavanone ( 71). Flavonoids/isoflavonoids not recorded in that review and/or from different Eriosema species are mentioned below.
